meanings.definition: The quality or state of being practical.
meanings.sent1: Her idea lacked practicability, making it difficult to implement.
meanings.sent2: The practicability of the plan made it easy to execute.
meanings.sent3: The lack of practicability in his invention left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: The practicability of her approach shone like a beacon in the sea of impractical ideas.
meanings.sent5: The practicability of using solar power was evident in the cost savings and efficiency.

meanings.definition: The capability of being done or put into practice.
meanings.sent1: The practicability of the project was evident from the start.
meanings.sent2: We assessed the practicability of the new system before implementing it.
meanings.sent3: His claim about the practicability of time travel raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The practicability of her solution was like a light at the end of a dark tunnel.
meanings.sent5: The practicability of learning a new language became clear as she practiced every day.
